NEDOCROMIL SODIUM

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Side effects
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Unlicensed use
  • Prescribing and dispensing
  • Treatment cessation
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Seasonal and perennial conjunctivitis,

To the eye

  • For adults
    Apply twice daily, increased if necessary to 4 times a day for maximum 12 weeks treatment with seasonal allergic conjunctivitis.
  • For children 6–17 years
    Apply twice daily, increased if necessary to 4 times a day for maximum 12 weeks treatment with seasonal allergic conjunctivitis.

Seasonal keratoconjunctivitis,

To the eye

  • For adults
    Apply 4 times a day.
  • For children 6–17 years
    Apply 4 times a day.

Prophylaxis of asthma,

By inhalation of aerosol

  • For adults
    Initially 4 mg 4 times a day, when control achieved may be possible to reduce to twice daily.
  • For children 5–17 years
    Initially 4 mg 4 times a day, when control achieved may be possible to reduce to twice daily.

Dose equivalence and conversion

2 puffs = 4 mg.

Advice when patient is pregnant

When used by inhalation

Inhaled drugs can be taken as normal during pregnancy.

Known side effects

Specific side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: abdominal pain, dyspepia, nausea, pharyngitis, vomiting,

rare: taste disturbances,

notKnown: distinctive taste, transient burning, transient stinging, bronchospasm, cough, headache, paradoxical bronchospasm, throat irritation,

When used by inhalation

Paradoxical bronchospasm

If paradoxical bronchospasm occurs, a short-acting beta2 agonist such as salbutamol or terbutaline should be used to control symptoms; treatment with nedocromil should be discontinued.

Advice for patients and carers

When used by inhalation

Regular use is necessary.

Patient counselling is advised for Nedocromil aerosol for inhalation (administration).

Unlicensed use

When used by inhalation in children

Not licensed for use in children under 6 years.

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

When used by inhalation

Flavours of inhalers may include mint.

Advice regarding ceasing treatment

When used by inhalation

Withdrawal should be done gradually over a period of one week—symptoms of asthma may recur.

Prepared medicinal forms of NEDOCROMIL SODIUM

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Pressurised inhalation
Eye drops
